channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023090417
item.description:
Report X-2023090417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was dropped during sortation causing damage to the contents which allowed it to leak. Pkg was placed in plastic bins and take to the HMPA for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: A small tear in the metal can from being dropped and crushed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin upright with damage/hole on bottom of contents.

item.title: Report X-2023090360
item.description:
Report X-2023090360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package went out for delivery and was returned to Station, consignee was not present to sign for DSR. Package leaked before another delivery attempt could be made. Package was left at QA workstation for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: One of the four plastic bottles has cracked cap, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023090329
item.description:
Report X-2023090329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg with no Hazmat markings containing Paint was found to be leaking and placed in an unauthorized unlined plastic bin. The bin was taken to the HMPA for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Failed friction lids with no safety clips on 2 x 5 L metal paint cans. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2023090361
item.description:
Report X-2023090361

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded into delivery van, went out for daily deliveries. Package was damaged during deliveries or Driver did not inspect load prior to leaving Station. Package was returned to Station and was brought to QA workstation for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. Reference HESS 104365, which was cancelled. This is a re-entry of an Undeclared Hazardous Materials package. Incident was initially recorded as Limited Quantity. Re-entered as Fully Regulated. DescribePack: One of the twelve aerosol cans is crushed at base. Aluminum can sidewall tore away from stainless steel base of can, permitting discharge of virtually all contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage.

item.title: Report X-2023090292
item.description:
Report X-2023090292

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and forwarded to tugger line on Non-Compatibles belt. Package leaked prior to being loaded onto delivery van. Package was brought to QA cage for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Three of the four 1-gallon bottles has loose caps, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.
